title: Apprehension of deserters
context: [ยง124A-12] Apprehension of deserters. Any civil officer having authority to apprehend offenders under the laws of the United States or this State or of a state, territory, commonwealth, or possession, or the District of Columbia may summarily apprehend a deserter from the state military forces and deliver the deserter into the custody of the state military forces. If an offender is apprehended outside the State, the offender&rsquo;s return to the area shall be in accordance with normal extradition procedures or reciprocal agreement. [L 1982, c 171, pt of ยง2; gen ch 1985]
